reasoning: Population-based incidence of bacterial arthritis (which includes prosthetic joint infections) is 5.7 per 100,000 inhabitants per year based on Dutch community-based prospective survey. While incidence in prosthetic procedures themselves is 1-2%, population-level rate accounts for the proportion of population with prosthetic joints.
source: Kaandorp CJ et al. (1997). Incidence and sources of native and prosthetic joint infection: a community based prospective survey. Annals of the Rheumatic Diseases. 56(8):470-475
